rescuecore2.misc

Class EncodingTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • rescuecore2.misc.EncodingTools

  • public final class EncodingTools
extends java.lang.Object
    A bunch of useful tools for encoding and decoding things like integers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INT_32_SIZE
      The size of an INT_32 in bytes.

              byte[] out,
              int offset)
        Write a 32-bit integer to a byte array, big-endian style.
        Parameters:
        i - The integer to write.
        out - The buffer to write it to.
        offset - Where in the buffer to write it.

      • readInt32

        public static int readInt32(java.io.InputStream in)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Read a 32-bit integer from an input stream, big-endian style.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        Returns:
        The next big-endian, 32-bit integer in the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the InputStream blows up.
        java.io.EOFException - If the end of the stream is reached.

      • readInt32

                     throws java.io.IOException
        Read a 32-bit integer from a DataInput.
        Parameters:
        in - The DataInput to read from.
        Returns:
        The next big-endian, 32-bit integer in the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the DataInput blows up.
        java.io.EOFException - If the end of the stream is reached.

                       throws java.io.IOException
        Read a 32-bit integer from an input stream, little-endian style.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        Returns:
        The next little-endian, 32-bit integer in the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the InputStream blows up.
        java.io.EOFException - If the end of the stream is reached.

      • readInt32

        public static int readInt32(byte[] in,
            int offset)
        Read a 32-bit integer from a byte array, big-endian style.
        Parameters:
        in - The buffer to read from.
        offset - Where to begin reading.
        Returns:
        The next big-endian, 32-bit integer in the buffer.

      • readInt32

        public static int readInt32(byte[] in)
        Read a 32-bit integer from a byte array, big-endian style. This is equivalent to calling readInt32(in, 0).
        Parameters:
        in - The buffer to read from.
        Returns:
        The first big-endian, 32-bit integer in the buffer.

      • writeString

        public static void writeString(java.lang.String s,
               byte[] out,
               int offset)
        Write a String to a byte array. Strings are always in UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to write.
        out - The byte array to write to. Make sure it's big enough!
        offset - The index to start writing from.

      • reallySkip

        public static void reallySkip(java.io.InputStream in,
              long count)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Call InputStream.skip until exactly count bytes have been skipped. If InputStream.skip ever returns a negative number then an EOFException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to skip.
        count - The number of bytes to skip.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the bytes cannot be skipped for some reason.

      • reallySkip

        public static void reallySkip(java.io.DataInput in,
              int count)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Call DataInput.skip until exactly count bytes have been skipped. If DataInput.skip ever returns a negative number then an EOFException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        in - The DataInput to skip.
        count - The number of bytes to skip.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the bytes cannot be skipped for some reason.
